class wp4.adverse_event.models.Category(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Allows S/AE events to be categorised for DMC reporting purposes. Outlined in Issue #190

Parameters:

  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - locked by the admin team
  • live (livefield.fields.LiveField) – “live”
  • description (django.db.models.CharField) – “AC01 category description”
description¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
event_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class wp4.adverse_event.models.Event(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Collects (serious) adverse event information related to a specific Organ within the study

Based strictly on the paper form for initial version, even though that form contains issues. Fields commented out in code likely refer to items added to help improve the process, but were rejected.

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • record_locked (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “record locked” - locked by the admin team
  • live (livefield.fields.LiveField) – “live”
  • organ_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “Trial ID”
  • serious_eligible_1 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the adverse event lead to death?”
  • serious_eligible_2 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did it result in a life-threatening illness or injury?”
  • serious_eligible_3 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did it result in a permanent impairment of a body structure or a body function?”
  • serious_eligible_4 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did it require hospitalisation?”
  • serious_eligible_5 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did it require prolongation of hospitalisation?”
  • serious_eligible_6 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did it result in medical or surgical intervention to prevent life-threatening illness or injury or permanent impairment to a body structure or a body function?”
  • onset_at_date (django.db.models.DateField) – “Date of Onset of Adverse Event”
  • event_ongoing (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Is the event still ongoing?”
  • description (django.db.models.TextField) – “Please describe the event”
  • action (django.db.models.TextField) – “Action taken”
  • outcome (django.db.models.TextField) – “Outcome”
  • alive_query_1 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event result in incapacity/inability to work?”
  • alive_query_2 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event result in a sign/symptom that interferes with the subject’s usual activity?”
  • alive_query_3 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event cause signs/symptoms that resolved with no sequelae?”
  • alive_query_4 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event arise from device deficiency?”
  • alive_query_5 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event arise from device user error?”
  • alive_query_6 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event result in a life-threatening illness or injury?”
  • alive_query_7 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event result in permanent impairment of a body structure or a body function?”
  • alive_query_8 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event require prolongation of hospitalisation?”
  • alive_query_9 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event result in medical or surgical intervention to prevent life-threatening illness or injury or permanent impairment to a body structure or a body function?”
  • rehospitalisation (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event require hospitalisation?”
  • date_of_admission (django.db.models.DateField) – “Date of admission”
  • date_of_discharge (django.db.models.DateField) – “Date of discharge”
  • admitted_to_itu (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Were they admitted to ITU?”
  • dialysis_needed (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Was dialysis needed?”
  • biopsy_taken (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Was a kidney biopsy taken?”
  • surgery_required (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Was surgery required?”
  • rehospitalisation_comments (django.db.models.TextField) – “Comments”
  • death (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Did the event lead to death?”
  • treatment_related (django.db.models.PositiveSmallIntegerField) – “Was death treatment related?”
  • cause_of_death_1 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Cerebrovascular Accident”
  • cause_of_death_2 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Multi Organ Failure”
  • cause_of_death_3 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Pneumonia”
  • cause_of_death_4 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Sepsis”
  • cause_of_death_5 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Transplant related”
  • cause_of_death_6 (django.db.models.BooleanField) – “Other”
  • cause_of_death_comment (django.db.models.CharField) – “If other, give details”
  • contact_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “Please select the contact who can provide more information” - AEh09 This should be the Local Investigator for the Transplant Centre
  • _order (django.db.models.OrderWrt) – ” order”
organ¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

categories¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

contact¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

country_for_restriction()[source]¶

Get the country to be used for geographic restriction of this data :return: Int: Value from list in Locations.Models. Should be in range [1,4,5]

location_for_restriction()[source]¶

Get the location to be used for geographic restriction of this data :return: Int: Hospital object id

is_serious¶

If any of the serious_eligible questions are True, then this is a serious event

Returns:True if any serious_event fields are True
Return type:bool
